Package net.regsirius06.engine.core.graphics

Class Filter

java.lang.Object
net.regsirius06.engine.core.graphics.Filter
public final class Filter extends Object
A utility class that provides color filtering operations such as mixing and applying masks (musk). This class contains static methods to combine, apply, or modify colors using various blending or masking techniques. All methods in this class return a new MathColor object.

  • Method Details

    • mix

      @Contract("_, _ -> new") @NotNull public static @NotNull MathColor mix(@NotNull @NotNull MathColor color1, @NotNull @NotNull MathColor color2)
      Mixes two MathColor objects by averaging each of their color components (red, green, blue). The resulting color is the component-wise average of the two input colors.
      Parameters:
      color1 - The first MathColor object to mix.
      color2 - The second MathColor object to mix.
      Returns:
      A new MathColor object representing the result of mixing the two input colors.

    • mix

      @Contract("_, _ -> new") @NotNull public static @NotNull MathColor mix(Color color1, Color color2)
      Mixes two Color objects by first converting them to MathColor and then mixing the resulting MathColor objects. This method allows mixing standard Java Color objects.
      Parameters:
      color1 - The first Color object to mix.
      color2 - The second Color object to mix.
      Returns:
      A new MathColor object representing the result of mixing the two input colors.

    • musk

      @Contract("_, _ -> new") @NotNull public static @NotNull MathColor musk(@NotNull @NotNull MathColor color, @NotNull @NotNull MathColor musk)
      Applies a musk (mask) to a MathColor object by taking the component-wise minimum value of the color and the musk. The resulting color has each component (R, G, B) being the minimum of the two input values.
      Parameters:
      color - The MathColor object to apply the musk to.
      musk - The MathColor object representing the musk (mask).
      Returns:
      A new MathColor object representing the result of applying the musk to the color.

    • musk

      @Contract("_, _ -> new") @NotNull public static @NotNull MathColor musk(@NotNull @NotNull MathColor color, @NotNull @NotNull Color musk)
      Applies a Color musk (mask) to a MathColor object by first converting the Color to MathColor. This method allows applying a Color mask to a MathColor.
      Parameters:
      color - The MathColor object to apply the musk to.
      musk - The Color object representing the musk (mask).
      Returns:
      A new MathColor object representing the result of applying the musk to the color.

    • musk

      @Contract("_, _ -> new") @NotNull public static @NotNull MathColor musk(@NotNull @NotNull Color color, @NotNull @NotNull Color musk)
      Applies a Color musk (mask) to another Color object by first converting both Color objects to MathColor. This method allows applying a Color mask to a Color object.
      Parameters:
      color - The Color object to apply the musk to.
      musk - The Color object representing the musk (mask).
      Returns:
      A new MathColor object representing the result of applying the musk to the color.

    • musk

      @Contract("_, _ -> new") @NotNull public static @NotNull MathColor musk(@NotNull @NotNull Color color, @NotNull @NotNull MathColor musk)
      Applies a MathColor musk (mask) to a Color object by first converting the Color object to MathColor. This method allows applying a MathColor mask to a Color object.
      Parameters:
      color - The Color object to apply the musk to.
      musk - The MathColor object representing the musk (mask).
      Returns:
      A new MathColor object representing the result of applying the musk to the color.

    • asLight

      @NotNull public static @NotNull MathColor asLight(@NotNull @NotNull Color color)
      Converts a Color object to a MathColor and applies a transformation to lighten the color. The color is "multiplied" by a negative factor and transformed using a mathematical operation to brighten it.
      Parameters:
      color - The Color object to transform into a lighter version.
      Returns:
      A new MathColor object representing the lightened version of the input color.

    • asLight

      @Contract("_ -> new") @NotNull public static @NotNull MathColor asLight(@NotNull @NotNull MathColor color)
      Applies a transformation to a MathColor to lighten it. The lightening process involves multiplying the color by a negative factor and then applying a square root operation.
      Parameters:
      color - The MathColor object to lighten.
      Returns:
      A new MathColor object representing the lightened version of the input color.
